conclusion: Two objects, A and B, move in the same direction along a straight line with velocities plotted against time.
In a v-t graph, the slope at any point gives the acceleration of the object.
Both curves start at the origin, reach a maximum velocity, and return to zero at time t1. Curve A peaks higher and earlier than curve B.
Acceleration is positive when velocity is increasing and negative when velocity is decreasing.
The question asks if accelerations are first increasing and then decreasing.
To determine acceleration changes, examine the slope of the v-t graph over time.
For object A, from t=0 to peak, acceleration is positive but decreasing as the curve is concave down.
From peak to t1, acceleration is negative and becomes more negative.
Acceleration decreases from positive to zero, then becomes negative and increases in magnitude.
Acceleration is decreasing first and then increasing in magnitude in the negative direction.
